clinical_study.brief_title: Interactions Between Drug Effects and Environments
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Contextual Conditioning With in Humans: Causes and Consequences

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine how associations between drugs and the places where they are experienced influence drug seeking, mood and acute drug responses.

detailed_description.textblock: Learned associations between drug effects and the people, places, and paraphernalia (cues) linked with drug experiences are a major barrier to the treatment of drug addiction. These links are remarkably persistent and can cause relapse to drug taking even after long periods of abstinence. They are also key features in some of the foremost theories of addiction, yet there is little clinical evidence of how these associations are formed and how they come to profoundly control behavior. The long-term goal of this research is to understand how drug cues become powerfully linked with drug experiences and their influence on mood and behavior. In the proposed project, the investigators will determine how associations between drugs and the places where they are experienced influence drug seeking, mood and acute responses to the drug. The hypothesis is that drug-paired environments will induce approach behavior and also alter acute subjective responses to the drug.This knowledge will lead to novel treatment strategies to counteract the effects of drug cues on mood and behavior, and also to prevent relapse.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in time spent in drug-paired room
primary_outcome.description: The amount of time spent in the room paired with drug is calculated during a 10 min exploration test. Exploration tests are conducted at the orientation session (pre-test) and then again at the testing session (post-test). The difference between the pre- and post-tests is calculated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Self-reported drug effects are measured 30min before drug administration and at 30min intervals after drug administration for 4h during each conditioning sessions

arm_group.description: Individuals receive 20mg methamphetamine on two separate occasions and placebo on two separate occasions. Paired group subjects always receive drug in the same room and placebo in the other room.
Individuals receive 20mg methamphetamine on two separate occasions and placebo on two separate occasions. Unpaired group subjects receive drug and placebo once in each room.

intervention.description: Administration of a rewarding drug is paired with a given context to assess whether we can change liking and preference for that environment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- past use of stimulants
- bmi 19-26
- hormonal birth control for women
Exclusion Criteria:
- current or recent (Past year) history of major axis I disorder
